net.sf.expectit

Interface Expect

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable

    public interface Expect
extends Closeable
    The main interface providing access to the expect operations.

    Input data for the operations is stored in the internal buffer growing while new data is being received from the underlying input stream. A successful match operation updates the buffer by removing a part from the begging until the end position of the match.

    The send methods are thread safe as long as the underlying output streams are thread safe. In other words it is safe to send data from one thread and expect the results in another.

      Sends the given byte array and flushes the output.
      Expect sendLine()
      Sends a new line to the output.
      Expect sendLine(String string)
      Appends the line separator character to the string and calls send(String) method.
      Expect withInfiniteTimeout()
      Sets the default timeout to infinity.
      Expect withTimeout(long duration, TimeUnit unit)
      Sets the default timeout in the given unit for the expect operations for the returned instance.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        Expect send(String string)
            throws IOException
        Sends the string to the output stream and flushes the output.

        The string is converted to bytes using charset set in the .ExpectBuilder.

        Parameters:
        string - the string to be sent
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O error occurs

      • sendLine

        Expect sendLine(String string)
                throws IOException
        Appends the line separator character to the string and calls send(String) method.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to be sent
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        send(String), ExpectBuilder.withLineSeparator(String)

      • sendLine

        Expect sendLine()
                throws IOException
        Sends a new line to the output. Simply calls the sendLine(String) method with empty string as a parameter.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O error occurs

        Expect sendBytes(byte[] bytes)
                 throws IOException
        Sends the given byte array and flushes the output.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this
        Throws:

      • expect

        <R extends Result> R expect(Matcher<R> matcher)
                        throws IOException
        Blocks until the given matcher matches against the first input stream using the default timeout.

        The method throws an AssertionError if ExpectBuilder.errorOnTimeout is set. Deprecated.

        An instance of EOFException will be thrown if the underlying input steam, the internal buffer is empty and the match operation is not successful.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the matcher type
        Parameters:
        matcher - the mather
        Returns:
        the match result
        Throws:
        ExpectIOException - if the matcher does not match and the the ExpectBuilder.withExceptionOnFailure() flag was set
        ClosedByInterruptException - if the thread calling this method has been interrupted
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • expect

        MultiResult expect(Matcher<?>... matchers)
                   throws IOException
        Blocks until all the given matchers match against the first input stream using the default timeout.

        The method throws an AssertionError if ExpectBuilder.errorOnTimeout is set. Deprecated.

        An instance of EOFException will be thrown if the underlying input steam, the internal buffer is empty and the match operation is not successful.

        Parameters:
        matchers - the matchers
        Returns:
        the match result from all the matchers
        Throws:
        ExpectIOException - if the matcher does not match and the the ExpectBuilder.withExceptionOnFailure() flag was set
        ClosedByInterruptException - if the thread calling this method has been interrupted
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • expect

        @Deprecated
<R extends Result> R expect(long timeoutMs,
                                     Matcher<R> matcher)
                        throws IOException
        Deprecated. This method is deprecated and will be removed. Use withTimeout(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) to change the timeout for the expect operation.
        Blocks until the given matcher matches the first input stream using the given timeout.

        The method throws an AssertionError if ExpectBuilder.errorOnTimeout is set. Deprecated.

        An instance of EOFException will be thrown if the underlying input stream, the internal buffer is empty and the match operation is not successful.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the matcher type
        Parameters:
        timeoutMs - the timeout for the expect operation in milliseconds, infinite if -1 is passed
        matcher - the mather
        Returns:
        the match result
        Throws:
        ExpectIOException - if the matcher does not match and the the ExpectBuilder.withExceptionOnFailure() flag was set
        ClosedByInterruptException - if the thread calling this method has been interrupted
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • expectIn

        <R extends Result> R expectIn(int input,
                            Matcher<R> matcher)
                          throws IOException
        Blocks until the given matcher matches against the given input stream using the default timeout.

        The method throws an AssertionError if ExpectBuilder.errorOnTimeout is set. Deprecated.

        An instance of EOFException will be thrown if the underlying input steam, the internal buffer is empty and the match operation is not successful.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the matcher type
        Parameters:
        input - the index of the input. if the index is outside of the boundaries, a runtime exception will be thrown
        matcher - the matcher
        Returns:
        the match result
        Throws:
        ExpectIOException - if the matcher does not match and the the ExpectBuilder.withExceptionOnFailure() flag was set
        ClosedByInterruptException - if the thread calling this method has been interrupted
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

                                       long timeoutMs,

                          throws IOException

        the match result
        Throws:

        ClosedByInterruptException - if the thread calling this method has been interrupted

      • expectIn

        @Deprecated
MultiResult expectIn(int input,
                              long timeoutMs,
                              Matcher<?>... matchers)
                     throws IOException
        Deprecated. This method is deprecated and will be removed. Use withTimeout(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) to change the timeout for the expect operation.
        Blocks until all the given matchers matche against the given input stream using the given timeout.

        The method throws an AssertionError if ExpectBuilder.errorOnTimeout is set. Deprecated.

        An instance of EOFException will be thrown if the underlying input steam, the internal buffer is empty and the match operation is not successful.

        Parameters:
        input - the index of the input. if the index is outside of the boundaries, a runtime exception will be thrown
        timeoutMs - the timeout for the expect operation in milliseconds, infinite if -1 is passed
        matchers - the matchers
        Returns:
        the match result from all the matchers
        Throws:
        ExpectIOException - if the matcher does not match and the the ExpectBuilder.withExceptionOnFailure() flag was set
        ClosedByInterruptException - if the thread calling this method has been interrupted
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • withTimeout

        Expect withTimeout(long duration,
                 TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the default timeout in the given unit for the expect operations for the returned instance. The timeout for this instance will remain unchanged. Both instances, this and the returned one, will share the same configuration except the default timeout value.
        Parameters:
        duration - the timeout value
        unit - the time unit
        Returns:
        an Expect instance with a new default timeout.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the timeout <= 0

      • withInfiniteTimeout

        Expect withInfiniteTimeout()
        Sets the default timeout to infinity. The timeout for this instance will remain unchanged. Both instances, this and the returned one, will share the same configuration except the default timeout value.
        Returns:
        an Expect instance with a new default timeout.

           throws IOException

      • interactWith

        InteractBuilder interactWith(int input)
        Starts the interactive loop for the given input.
        Parameters:
        input - the index of the input stream to use for the interact loop.
        Returns:
        the interact builder.
